item.title: Man accused of domestic violence hurts two police officers
item.description: One resident wounded two police with a knife while trying to resist a detention. The case happened on Thursday after the man was the subject of a new ex-wife complaint for two theft crimes. Already last year he had been accused of domestic violence. According to the newspaper or Mun, the Judiciary Police (PJ) was able to stop the man on Thursday after receiving a complaint for the ex-wife's theft. The alleged criminal was arrested near the vicinity of the former partner's housing. When he realized that he was going to be arrested, the man tried to escape and used a knife to resist, slightly hurting two of the agents. According to the contours of the case, after the divorce, the victim went to live alone in the Nam Van area. Man was applied as a measure of coercion the prohibition of contact with women, due to physical aggression, which will have happened in January. However, on 25 February, the suspect violated the coercion measure, and went to the victim's house to discuss money issues. That day he physically assaulted the woman, besides having pointed to him a knife. The attacker also locked the woman at home for 31 hours. Before leaving, he stole a suitcase of 9,000 patacas that was sold by the suspect in the interior of China for 2,000 Renminbis. On the 18th of this month, the man returned to his wife's house, took advantage of the fact that the door was not locked and asked him for money again. Once again he kidnapped the woman in the apartment for 15 hours, forcing her to apply for a 5,000-pass loan from a friend. The case was referred to the MP for the crimes of forbidden weapon, theft, kidnapping, resistance and coercion, qualified offense to physical integrity and domestic violence. Appeal to protection After becoming public, the General Association of Macao Women's Women came to ask the government to improve the protection measures provided for in the Domestic Violence Prevention and Combat Law. For long years, this association has taken an abstention position in the face of the possibility of allowing the police to investigate the crimes of domestic violence without a complaint of the victims. item.title: Tickets for sale since Saturday to the 35th edition of FAM

It is presented to the public, with organization of the Cultural Institute (IC), a set of 15 shows that cover theater, Chinese opera, dance, circus, music and visual arts. It is an adaptation of a classic play centered on the life of the talented playwright Kong Yu-Kau, which will provide viewers with a totally new experience, maintaining the dramatic intensity of the piece and ingeniously integrating innovative elements of the Cantonense opera. item.title: Demography | Macaense population in San Francisco surpasses Macau
item.description:
A study released by a Chinese researcher concludes that, currently, the population of Macanese and Luso-Asia that resides in the area of ​​San Francisco Bay in the United States is larger than that of Macao
"There are about 70,000 macanese and Luso-Asia to reside in San Francisco, which is more than the number in Macao," researcher Leong Wong Un NA was told Lusa, who presented last Thursday at the University of Macao, the book "Macanese and Luso-Assian in the San Francisco Bay Area" from 1940 to 1950, a title that results from his doctoral thesis. According to the latest censuses held in Macao in 2021, only 13,021 residents in Macau had Portuguese ancestry, representing 1.9 percent of the total population. The data also reveal that 6,668 people, 1 percent of the total population, had Chinese and Portuguese descent, characteristics usually used to define the Macanese community. The Portuguese Leadership Council of the United States has a total population of 1,454,262 with Portuguese ancestry. According to Leong, the Macanese, some of which had departed to various regions of Asia in the nineteenth century, Luso-Asian and the Portuguese in Asia, emigrated to the United States from Macao in the twentieth century, due to political and economic reasons, choosing as the main destination of the São Francisco Bay in California. The Language Question Leong Wong Un NA, a Chinese who grew up in Macao and says maintaining a close relationship with the Macanese community, has many family members resident in San Francisco, including parents and siblings. The immigrated macanese and Luso-Asiatic-symatics in San Francisco, concluded Leong, were not soon recognized as Portuguese when they arrived in the United States and were even discriminated against for decades by the Portuguese community itself. At the same time the Communist Party was taking power in China, “the macanese and the Luso-Asiatics, when they immigrated there [San Francisco], could not participate in the organizations created by the Portuguese of Portugal,” said Leong Wong Un na. "Some of the descendants of Portuguese who came from Asia did not speak fluent Portuguese, so the Portuguese from Portugal said that if they did not know Portuguese, they were not Portuguese," he explained. Leong describes in his book not only how the community of Macaenses and Luso-Asia that is currently living in the area of ​​São Francisco Bay, such as the origins and cultural traits of the Portuguese community and even the architectural characteristics they have imprinted on the urban surroundings. The researcher concluded that the Macaenses and Luso-Asia of San Francisco "maintain habits still very alive in Macau, such as the Macaense cuisine and the Catholic religion."

item.title: Economy | Great consumption award starts today
item.description:
The campaign to incentive for the Community Economy major consumption prize starts today. For each electronic payment platform used to buy something more than 50 patacas, three hypotheses are given to earn discount coupons to spend on the weekend. The people of Macau Pass for the elderly can receive 300 Patacas today in immediate discount
The new round of the Grand Prix of Consumption starts today and ends on June 1, with the aim of stimulating trade and businesses of small and medium enterprises in the city's neighborhoods. The initiative organized by the Government, together with the Macau Commercial Association, aims to “promote the local consumer environment, increase confidence in the consumer market, as well as further improve the exploitation of community zones commercial establishments”, describes the direction of Economics and Technological Development Services (DSEDT), at a time when closed commercial spaces has become a common scenario throughout the city. Starting today, those who make during the days of the week a purchase of more than 50 patacas through the mobile phone will have three opportunities a week to earn electronic discount coupons that can be used the following Saturday and Sunday. If the user has more than one mobile application, with real name authentication, he may participate in the initiative with the applications accepted in the program. That is, if the resident uses MPay, the BOC Macau application, or BNU Pay, which generate QR codes to make payments, can participate with all applications and for each one get up to three discount coupons. Discount coupons, which this year will have a maximum value of 200 patacas, can be used to buy something that has until triple the discount value, ie provides a discount of one third of the value of the product. In this round, it will also be allowed to add more than one coupon, maintaining the discount value in one third. Discounts on the week expire if they are not used on Saturday and Sunday in the more than 20,000 Macao physical stores that accept them. Pass card The biggest novelty of this round is the immediate discount benefits for the consumption of elderly that can be used every day during the course of the activity. Starting today, Macau Pass card patients can get immediate discount benefits of 300 patacas by loading the card in more than 120 services indicated in Macao. In addition, they can also win electronic discount coupons through mobile payment platforms, "enjoying two types of benefits." However, immediate consumption discounts provided by the card bring added benefits. In addition to being able to be used every day during the campaign, with no maximum limit of daily use, they provide discounts of 50 percent. When an elderly person buy goods or services of the total of 600 patacas with the Macau Pass card for the elderly, you will only have to shell out 300 patacas from your own money. The card can be loaded at more than 400 loading stations, including Macau Pass service centers, convenience stores, commercial stores and large supermarket chains. Discounts cannot be used to pay water, electricity, natural gas, fuels, telecommunications services, transfronhetic transport services, medical services, services provided by public institutions. Nor can they be used in casinos, banks, insurers and other financial institutions, pledge houses, large -scale supermarkets, property management, educational institutions, parking parks, taxis, parking meters, installation of automatic sales machines.

item.title: Diplomacy | Paulo Rangel has a meeting with Sam Hou Fai on Friday
item.description:
The Minister of State and Foreign Affairs visits China this week, on a four -day trip that includes contacts with Chinese government representatives and a stint at Macao. Paulo Rangel's agenda includes a meeting with Sam Hou Fai and the visit to the Portuguese School of Macau
Portuguese Minister of State and Foreign Affairs, Paulo Rangel, begins a visit to China that will include a time at Macau and Hong Kong on Friday, the last day of the ticket to China. At Mishes, the Portuguese politician will meet representatives of associations, educational institutions and entrepreneurs and will visit the Portuguese School of Macao. Paulo Rangel will meet equally with the head of the Executive of the MSAR, Sam Hou Fai, and the advisers of the Portuguese communities elected by the Circle of China (China, Korea, Japan, Singapore and Thailand). The official program of Paulo Rangel's visit ends with a visit to the exhibition “Stories Lusas”, an initiative dedicated to the Portuguese community, at the Hong Kong History Museum. Departure home However, before heading to Macau, the agenda of the head of Portuguese diplomacy starts tomorrow in Beijing, at 10am, with a meeting with the director general of the international department of the Chinese Communist Party, Minister Liu Jinchao, indicates a statement released on Friday by the ministry protected by Rangel. There is a meeting with Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi and a meeting with Beijing Foreign Studies University, Jia Wenjian. Still in the Chinese capital, Paulo Rangel will give a lecture at Beijing Foreign Studies University (BFSU) subordinate to the theme “Portuguese Language and Culture”. The next day, already in Haikou (southern China), the Portuguese minister intervenes in the "Boa Forum Forum for Asia 2025", the annual conference held in the Chinese province of Haião that aims to promote and deepen the exchange, coordination and economic cooperation between Asia and other parts of the world. Also on Wednesday, Paulo Rangel has foreseen a bilateral meeting with Chinese vice-prime minister, Ding Xuexiang. The Minister of State and Foreign Affairs also participates on Thursday at the plenary session of the Boa Forum for Asia 2025 and has scheduled bilateral meetings.

item.title: Hengqin | Sam Hou Fai calls for more efforts and reform spirit
item.description:
The priority to realize the development of the in -depth cooperation zone involves the study of the spirit of Xi Jinping's discourses. This is one of the four expectations presented by the Chief Executive for the in -depth cooperation zone
The learning of the “Macau + Hengqin” concept presented by Xi Jinping is the priority in the development of the deepened cooperation zone between Canton and Macao in Hengqin. The goal was outlined by Sam Hou Fai, chief executive and co-chief of the deepened cooperation zone management committee during the latest working meeting on Saturday. About the “next phase of development” of the cooperation zone, Sam Hou Fai presented four “expectations” to guide the work. The first is "learning and seriously implementing the important" Macau + Hengqin "approach presented by President XI Jinping, and" deeply understanding its rich connotations and practical requirements, making all efforts to create a new conjuncture of the cooperation zone. " In the official version of the meeting issued by the Macao government, the “important approach” is not explained, nor are the “connotations” and “practical requirements” specifically indicated. As a second expectation, Sam asked the members of the Commission "more efforts to reform and innovation" of the cooperation zone, and the willingness to "courageously exploit innovative policies and the convergence of rules and mechanisms, to overcome hengqin development restrictions." Also in this regard, the “restrictions” that have been found were not detailed. As a third expectancy, the Macao government leader asked for a reinforcement of the ability to work and willingness to "achieve advances." Finally, Sam considered that Macau has to reinforce support to the authorities across the border to promote "new achievements in all strands." Positive balance Looking at the work of the last three years, Sam Hou Fai considers that they have been achieved "positive progress" and that "the level of integration between Hengqin and Macau has gradually improved." The chief executive also argued that the role of the cooperation zone as a support of “diversified development of the economy of Macao is becoming increasingly evident”. In turn, Guangdong Province Governor Wang Weizhong, the other co-chief of the in-depth cooperation zone, said the commission will “strive to develop the four new industries, to enhance the Guangdong-Macau Circuit Design Park in Hengqin, the Chinese Traditional Medicine Park, the Transfronho Electronic Trade Industrial Park. and the Innovation Industrial Park Hengqin-Macau ”. In addition, he pointed out as priority works, the reinforcement of “dissemination and promotion of preferred policies and the planning and introduction of industrial projects”, as well as the attraction of “more qualified frames with innovative ideas, capital, companies and residents of Macao to animate the business environment of the cooperation zone”.

item.title: Public Hiring | New regime “is on the good way,” says lawyer
item.description:
Marco Caldeira, a lawyer and auxiliary teacher at the University of Lisbon Faculty of Law, argues that the proposed public hiring law, under analysis in the specialty in Hemiciclo, is “on the good way” regarding the attempt to “promote transparency and competition and bet on digitization”. The theme was discussed last week at the Macau Scientific and Cultural Center
The proposal of public hiring, currently under analysis in the specialty in the First Permanent Commission of the Legislative Assembly (AL), was one of the topics addressed in the “Spring Conferences”, at the Macao Scientific and Cultural Center (CCCM) last week. The author of the lecture, the lawyer and teacher Marco Caldeira, made praise for the diploma for his attempt to reform and innovation in many respects. "Although not perfect, the bill under discussion is justified by the need to update legislation that was approved four decades ago. It is a proposal that seems to point in the good way, with an effort to codify the regime, promote transparency and competition and bet on digitization," said the professor at the University of Lisbon Law School (FDUL) to HM. In addition, Marco Caldeira understands that the diploma, and the content proposed by the government, aims to "follow what are good practices adopted in Europe and the West in general." "It is also very commendable that the proposal was prepared following a serious and participated procedure of public consultation, which gave the opportunity to economic operators and contracting entities to identify deficiencies in current legislation and make suggestions," added Marco Caldeira. At the CCCM session, the FDUL professor also pointed out that the concern [demonstrated, in the diploma] with the competition and transparency of the procedures ”, as well as“ the focus on training in the use of databases, as well as the focus on centralization ”. The teacher also understood that, in this bill, the Portuguese regime "can help, because the practice followed in Portugal, and legislative evolutions, have useful teachings that, with proper adaptations, can be transposed to Macao." Positive points In the presentation at CCCM, Marco Caldeira highlighted several positive aspects of the current law proposal, namely “the express determination of inapplicability to certain contracts”, or the fact that “fundamental principles of public hiring” are established. It is also required with the new law “qualifications to candidates and competitors” of public tenders, and there is also “the clarification and standardization of the types of public hiring procedures”. Thus, a “centralized hiring regime” is created, as well as regulating “award criteria” in competitions, and the creation of an exclusive website for the public hiring area is also foreseen. Marco Caldeira also drew attention to the real need of this diploma, as public hiring was legislated with various diplomas, including two decrees of 1984 and 1985, which established, respectively, the expenditure regime with works and service acquisitions, and the process of acquisition of goods and services. Such diplomas were “undone of reality” of Macao, even though the 1984 decree was reviewed in 2021, the teacher considered. Marco Caldeira also considered that the process of reviewing this diploma has been “lengthy”, as the public consultation took place between November 6, 2018 and January 4, 2019, and a later report was prepared, but the truth is that the proposal has been under analysis since December 2023, having been voted generally on January 11 last year. What has to change In the same session, the causal and university professor also highlighted the points already addressed by the first Standing Commission of AL regarding the necessary changes to legislate in the area of ​​public hiring. It was imposed “expressly consecrating fundamental legal principles, such as economy, efficiency and effectiveness, as well as publicity and transparency”, and there is also “a lack of regulation of public hiring policies”. There was also the “need to promote transparency in public hiring procedures” and ensure “greater protection of loyal competition”. There was also “lack of rigorous and explicit regulation on the composition and operation of the proposals evaluation committees” submitted to a public tender, and there is “lack of explicit demands on the qualifications and capabilities of candidates and competitors in hiring procedures”. Other gaps point to “insufficient regulation and transparency in the evaluation and adjudication procedures”, or “lack of explicit regulation on proposals presentation with an abnormally low price”. It was still necessary to “improve the sanctioning and inspection regime”, as well as bet on “regulation that promotes the development of electronic hiring”. Says the executive Looking at the justification of the law proposal, submitted by the Executive to AL, it is read that one of the great reasons for his presentation was even the legislative dispersion that was verified and the misfit over the current reality. "The nuclear part of these diplomas was prepared in the mid-1980s, and has been in force for over 30 years. A significant part of the provisions of other legal diplomas already has an obvious divergence regarding the needs of Macao's current socioeconomic development, the efficiency of public administration management and the reinforcement of transparency and supervision," he reads. According to the executive, "given that public hiring involves the use of the public purse, it is essential to review these regimes in order to meet the needs of the society of our day." Thus, in this law proposal, “the process and regime of expenses and acquisitions of goods and services” are regulated, with some provisions of a 1999 law, as “the provisions related to the public works contract regime have a high degree of specialization and are still effective”. It is intended, with the new law of public hiring, to “guarantee justice, impartiality in the evaluation of proposals”, defining “expressly aid criteria and rigorously determining the rules of conduct of workers and members of the opening and evaluation of proposals” subjected to contest, so that “excerpt their functions impartially and entirely”. Thus, it is foreseen that “contracting entities must adequately publicize the informative elements related to public hiring procedures”. They are “those related to the public tender, the clarifications provided, the rectification of documents, the extension of the deadline for the presentation of proposals, the causes for non -adjudication, the decision to annul the procedure and the award decision”. In order to guarantee loyal competition, the government wants to ensure that all entities interested in participating in a competition have “the broader access” to all procedures, prohibiting “all acts, agreements or practices that can prevent, false or restrict competition”. Moreover, there is the “principle of impartiality”, which determines that “the program of procedures, book of charges or other documents, made by the contracting party, cannot contain any clause designed to favor or harm a particular interested party”.

item.title: World Book Day | IC organizes “Book Exchange” and various activities
item.description:
April is a month to celebrate the reading. On the 23rd, the “World Book Day” takes place, and in this context, the government, through the Cultural Institute, will organize a series of programs to promote reading, such as the exchange of old books, and other activities
Celebra-se no próximo dia 23 de Abril o “Dia Mundial do Livro” e, assim sendo, o Instituto Cultural (IC) organiza actividades como a “Troca de Livros”. Em vários locais da cidade estarão também assinalados pontos de leitura, numa actividade designada por “Mês de Leitura Conjunta em Toda a Cidade de Macau 2025”, ou seja, ao longo do mês de Abril. The “Book Exchange” initiative has begun, notably with regard to the process of collecting books that people can have in their homes and who want to exchange for others through a point system. The delivery of old works can be done until April 13, and residents can deliver their collections of books that meet the conditions required in the 11 public libraries under the IC aegis, including the Macao Central Library, the Sir Robert Ho Tung library, the mud library and the Seac Pai Van library, among others. This year, for the first time, there will be an electronic system of points, and each book will be classified according to the original price, being attributed a unit for every 10 patacas or to a fraction of not less than five patacas. The maximum score per book or collection is 100 units. In collection of electronic points, residents can use the application “my library”. The exchange of books will take place on April 26 and 27, with the points obtained to be replaced by the new works chosen, to the counters of the Macao Cultural Center and the Auditorium of the Seac Pai Van Activities Center. The IC describes that, in the book exchange system, no textbooks and textbooks, magazines, pornographic publications, damaged books or non -original books are allowed. Readings in the city Another activity of promoting the book, is the “reading points”, a program where you can register the entities or associations of the territory. The aim is to “share reading time in community neighborhoods, increase participation and broaden reading coverage to the public”. Thus, interested parties can submit their proposals for the organization of “reading points” by April 30, and these “points” can be organized in stores, restaurants, schools, educational centers, associations, companies and offices, with no format limitations. Participating entities must organize reading activities by their own initiative from April 1st to 30th and present photographs and the number of participants after the activities. Relevant photographs will be published on the thematic electronic page of libraries and on the cultural pages of IC on social networks, “so that more residents can feel the charm of reading,” explains the IC.

item.title: Hengqin | Marathon delayed after attack that killed 35 people
item.description: More than 19,000 people participated yesterday at the Hengqin marathon, which had been postponed after the city in southern China was the scene of an attack with a car that killed 35 people. Authorities in the deepened cooperation zone between Guangdong and Macau in Hengqin reported that athletes from 12 countries and regions participated in the marathon, half marathon races and in a six -kilometer race. In a statement, local authorities stressed that more than 900 runners came from Macao and showed hope that sport could also reinforce cooperation with neighboring semi -autonomous region. The marathon was originally scheduled for December 29, but six days earlier, the organization postponed the marathon to March 23, without any reason. Marathon organizers include in -depth cooperation authorities between Guangdong and Macau in Hengqin, the Zhuhai Huafa group and Nam Kwong, a group controlled by the Guangdong province authorities but based in Macao. By the end of November, the organizers had already postponed this year's edition of the Zhuhai Marathon, which was initially scheduled for December 8. The competition had been scheduled for January 12, 2025, but was eventually canceled. On November 11, Fan Weqiu, a 62 -year -old man, drove a car deliberately against a multitude in a sports center in Zhuhai, causing the death of 35 people and injuries to 43. The striker “was angry” with the divorce process defined, according to a preliminary police investigation.

item.title: Technology | More families with internet access in 2024
item.description: Last year, about 97.7 percent of household aggregates sde macau accessed the internet, equivalent to 200,200 household aggregates, a total of 205,000 families. Data on the use of the Internet in Macau were revealed by the Directorate of Statistics and Census Services (DSEC) and represent a growth of 0.4 percentage points in annual terms. About 99.4 percent of household aggregates who accessed the internet used the mobile network. The number of Internet users in Macau was 610,300, plus 13,000 people, a growth of 2.2 percent compared to the year 2023. Approximately 91.4 percent of users accessed the internet daily, with the penetration rate increasing 1.2 percentage points to 94 percent. The Internet penetration rate increased by 1.2 percentage points to 94 percent of the population for 2023. The rate of individuals aged 65 or over, recorded the most remarkable growth of 3.5 percentage points, causing 81.3 percent of the elderly to use the internet. As for purposes, most users aimed to use communication applications or social networks, a total of 578,600 users. Use for entertainment (547,300 users) and online banking services or mobile payments (457,400) was followed.

item.title: PAULO MAIA AND CARMO
item.description: Zhu Houcong (1507-67), Emperor Jiajing devoting a lot of his time to his own person, discovered the state's affairs, delegating them in the corrupt Yan Song (1480-1567) who, among other infamies, would have a recognized righteous man who denounced him in a memorial sent to the monarch where his resignation proposed. This is called this poet literate and painter Yang Jisheng (1516-1555). The animadversion he felt in the face of injustice, risking his life to tell the truth, did not allow him to falter. Late on the night of December 2, 1553, feeling grateful for so many things that life had given him, in a conversation with his wife, Mrs. Zhang, who installed him to avoid the conflict given the impossibility of counteracting Yan Song's power, he replied that this was the way he had to pay all the assets he had received, as he recalled in a chronological biography (Nianpu). And yet, like many celebrated literati, he had also suffered exile on the distant margins of the Empire. It was in the course of one of these days in 1551 that, moved by the beauty of a landscape, made the painting traveling along the roller coaster (vertical roll, paint on paper, 147.5 x 39.5 cm, sold on Sotheby's) where he reveals his scholarship in the art of painting the literati in which the painted figure tends to the abstraction and the accompanying poem. In front of the mountain, whose name can be translated as "the heavenly beauty," he writes: «The Tianhua Mountain is not too far west of the provincial city walls,/ which chases admire these climbing blue-peeled blue clutches and rocks of a red-red!/ Towers and pavilions settle to the mutant shapes of the descent and climbed the mountain,/ shadows of flags and shamelies up and down the trees. shining against the vision of the clean sky,/ clouds entering; One could catch one with the sleeve. Yang Jisheng made in this painting a literate traveling in a river on a vessel that is suddenly alerted by the boatman who with a staff points to houses nested on the mountain. As on an album page that signed Jiaoshan, "Pepper Mountain" (PAPER, 27 x 35 cm ink, sold in the auctioneer Nagel) represented a home hung on top of a mountain, would say the figuration of its search for a place in the world, which would after all to refuse it. In the night that preceded his execution he wrote a famous pair of verses, in a practice known as Juemingshi, "poem of a cut life", which seeks to make a brief reflection on the meaning of his own life: "Iron Shoulders, to carry the length and the way,/ the pungent hand to writing ingeniously."

item.title: Today Macau
item.description: One resident wounded two police with a knife while trying to resist a detention. The case happened on Thursday after the man was the subject of a new ex-wife complaint for two theft crimes. Already last year he had been accused of domestic violence. According to the newspaper or Mun, the Judiciary Police (PJ) was able to stop the man on Thursday after receiving a complaint for the ex-wife's theft. The alleged criminal was arrested near the vicinity of the former partner's housing. When he realized that he was going to be arrested, the man tried to escape and used a knife to resist, slightly hurting two of the agents. According to the contours of the case, after the divorce, the victim went to live alone in the Nam Van area. Man was applied as a measure of coercion the prohibition of contact with women, due to physical aggression, which will have happened in January. However, on 25 February, the suspect violated the coercion measure, and went to the victim's house to discuss money issues. That day he physically assaulted the woman, besides having pointed to him a knife. The attacker also locked the woman at home for 31 hours. Before leaving, he stole a suitcase of 9,000 patacas that was sold by the suspect in the interior of China for 2,000 Renminbis. On the 18th of this month, the man returned to his wife's house, took advantage of the fact that the door was not locked and asked him for money again. Once again he kidnapped the woman in the apartment for 15 hours, forcing her to apply for a 5,000-pass loan from a friend. The case was referred to the MP for the crimes of forbidden weapon, theft, kidnapping, resistance and coercion, qualified offense to physical integrity and domestic violence. Appeal to protection After becoming public, the General Association of Macao Women's Women came to ask the government to improve the protection measures provided for in the Domestic Violence Prevention and Combat Law. For long years, this association has taken an abstention position in the face of the possibility of allowing the police to investigate the crimes of domestic violence without a complaint of the victims. The director of the association's Lai Yuen Solidarity Center, Wong Law Law, came to the authorities to review the victims' protection measures during the proceedings that have not yet been tried, but where there were complaints, to ensure effective protection of the victims. Wong Law Lei also highlighted the need for the authorities to investigate well the reason that led to the woman had not filed a complaint earlier, tolerating the aggressions.

item.title: Aviation | Maria José de Freitas regrets removal of panels from the airport
item.description:
The first attempts to establish in Macao airlines in the early twentieth century were approached by historian Célia Reis in the “Spring Conferences” of the Macao Scientific and Cultural Center. The architect Maria José de Freitas regretted the removal of panels from Macao International Airport that told this same story
Between the departure of the plane and the entrance to Macao International Airport (AIM) was a corridor that told the history of civil and military aviation from the territory of the early twentieth century. The project of this area of ​​the airport is by the studio of architect Maria José de Freitas, which regrets the removal of the panels and historical information that were installed in 2013. The architect left this idea in an intervention after the presentation of historian Célia Reis about the history of civil and military aviation in Macao on Monday, on the occasion of the “Spring Conferences” that take place at the Macao Scientific and Cultural Center (CCCM) in Lisbon. “We decided to tell the story of Aviation in Macao in this corridor, with a great extent, although at the time there was little documentation about it. I discovered some information in a work by Luís Andrade de Sá. We collected texts and images and put it all on the walls of this corridor, and that was there for a while.” "With a new direction [at AIM], I was asked how I could prove that all these events had happened. I had documentation in Portuguese, but I had nothing in Chinese and English, and at a time when I moved to Portugal on vacation, I saw, when I returned to Macau, who had removed all the information and images from this corridor. This story is unfortunate," he added. The architect added that she would like the history of the early days of Aviation in Macao to be told in these same walls. "It would be important to realize where there is more information, so that they realize the history of aviation in Macao, which was a pioneer. There was, for example, an aviation hangar near the mud houses, and there are a series of references linked to the history of this land that should be made visible at the airport, in the rooms, for example. This story should be told and things should be placed in the right place," he said. Ricou plans Célia Reis, historian and teacher, is developing an investigation project around the early days of aviation in Macao and this was the theme that led to the “spring conferences” on Monday, with the session “Aviation and Air Navigation in Macao in the 1920s-a process of colonial innovation”. Célia Reis spoke of a time when aviation began to be important to China for security reasons, and also begins to be thought to Macau. In this process, there is a personality whose name is important, a Hong Kong -born Frenchman: Charles William Ricou, a engineering and aviation pilot. From November 1919 the possibility of “establishing an air career between Macao, Hong Kong, Shanghai, Philippines, Java, India” began to equate, from November 1919, the possibility of Macaoi, Shanghai, Java, India, "contacting local government entities to obtain facilities and agreements. Célia Reis explained that Ricou intended to form two airlines, the “Far East Aviation Company”, with “a much wider connection, reaching Manila”, and another to connect Macau, Hong Kong and Cantão, named “Macau Aerial Transport Company”. This company "was constituted in Hong Kong, with a capital of $ 50,000, and had as founding partners personalities from Macau, such as Humberto de Avelar, Rodrigues dos Santos, Francisco Nolasco and Francisco da Silva". The historian also said in the presentation that the idea "was to complete the rest of the capital necessary with low value actions so that they could be bought by all [the inhabitants] in Macao." "There is even the appeal of the company's board of directors for the Macanese to subscribe to capital, showing that the company was extremely important for the inhabitants of Macao, highlighting its patriotic value, of solidarity with progress," he added. "Several voices demonstrated at that time that the company's commercial success, at first, could be little or none, although it was thought that the company could have some profits, having the ability to transport the air mail. However, this transportation capacity would be extremely limited, as the number of mail objects to transport from Macau was 24 letters a day," said Célia Reis. At the time it was thought that Macau would be a pioneer, because "it would be the first territory the Early East to have an aviation company", something that would "bring more visitors and increase trade." The Government of Macao, then led by Governor Correia da Silva, "gives in to the company's appeals, granting various facilities, such as the permission to build a provisional hangar on public ground that was vacant or from sea access infrastructure." In addition, “exemption from payment of the fuel storage tax” was allowed. Thus, Macao even had hydroavião and 21 American airmen hired by the company. "It was considered that it was the largest load of air material exported by the United States of America (USA), all brought to Macao." Then the company tries to organize itself, "even asking for space on Taipa Island, designed to have definitive hangars, although provisional concessions have existed." In this context, he recalled the historian, "there were subsidies, a contract for the transportation of postal bags", to "allow a development of air navigation." Impasses to the end In May 1920, a new worldwide aviation convention emerged, to which Portugal adheres, which causes the “Macau Aerial Transport Company” to be nationalized. The project comes to advance, but quickly retreats. “The airline therefore accesses the condition of obtaining a subsidy, and having four aircraft available for military service in Macau, if necessary. The issue of defense was always present. There was then some disagreement between the conditions required by the company and those that the governor understood were necessary. In addition, the government of Macao needed the Lisbon authorization for the operation of the airline. Advance, and this one begins to negotiate with the company. But voices begin to emerge in Lisbon that will make things change. ” This is the idea that the US would be showing hidden interests through the establishment of the company. "[In Lisbon] it is fear that this is the found form of an American aviation company to settle in Macao, Portuguese territory, by different ways." First, Lisbon forbids, retreating in the negotiations, and the next governor, Rodrigo Rodrigues, "is not in accordance with the company, understanding that it will not be viable," which leads to the entire project and dialogue to be suspended. Célia Reis also pointed out that "the government of Correia da Silva has undergone several difficulties in these years, in terms of security", having occurred "very serious incidents in the relationship between Portugal and China". “For this reason, the governor considered that having airplanes was extremely important because, at this moment, China was also resorting to aviation. The authorities of Portugal, however, considered that the planes of Macao would be of no importance, comparing with the set of aircraft that would have China or even Japan. When permission for the constitution of the airline in Macao, Lisbon understands that the territory could have in a worrying situation and planes could have functions with planes Military, even if there were few, ”explained the historian. The project would fall, however, by land.

item.title: A horta de Almerindo em Timor-Leste pode ser regada de Portugal ou Inglaterra
item.description: The Garden of the Timorese Almerindo Fernandes in Lautém, 231 kilometers east from Dili, can be watered from Portugal or England, after the civil engineer applied new technologies to the agricultural sector. Almerindo Fernandes, 30, has a degree in Civil Engineering and for years has worked on rural road construction projects, but the 'animal' for agriculture spoke louder and today owns Timor-Leste's first 'smart farm'. In Lautém, Almerindo Fernandes has about two hectares of terrain, where he planted eggplant, tomatoes and other vegetables, which watering through an intelligent irrigation system that controls through a platform on his mobile phone. "It means that in Portugal or England we can water the garden with the mobile phone. It's the modern world, the world of technology, digitization. It's the opportunity to use technology, using the mobile phone to water my garden," he told Lusa. "It is a great opportunity to use technology to modernize agricultural productions," he said. With about 1.3 million inhabitants, the agricultural sector in Timor-Leste is vital to the economy of the country, but production is low and did not follow the growth of the population. According to the United Nations Food and Agriculture Organization, more than 70% of the Timorese population lives in rural areas and most practice subsistence agriculture. Almerindo Fernandes started the activity in 2017 with the money he was sparing while working as a civil engineer and today sells his production to the school lunch program, the Armed Forces and the markets of his municipality. “So far it was a private activity, but the government is supporting the expansion of the project to the other municipalities of the country,” explained Almerindo Fernandes. The support was achieved after presenting the project to the vice-prime minister, coordinating minister of social affairs and Minister of Rural Development and Community Housing, Mariano Assanami Sabino, who eventually hired him as a specialized technician to bring the concept to the rest of the country. “The government recognizes the creativity of young people and all citizens who have creative initiatives. It is a great opportunity and the government is supporting the transformation of the garden into a youth formation center,” explained Almerindo Fernandes. In the garden, Almerindo Fernandes already has to work four people permanent and then hire others to plant, take the vegetables and do the maintenance, and at the same time gives training to young people who study agriculture. Now, according to the civil engineer, the garden also serves to do experiences to improve the system, that is, to make it more efficient and effective, with “little spent and greater performance”. "It is the principle of modernization, increased production, minimal cost is the purpose of the intelligent garden system and it is a theory we have to adapt to Timor to develop the country," he said.

item.title: IC | Launched book on the historical roots of Rua das Estlagês
item.description:
“In Search of Its Roots - An Illustrated History of Rua das Estlagês” is the name of the work Bilingual, released in digital format, which tells the story of this historic street of Macao, revealing the business that survived the passage of time. Production was in charge of the Macao Artists Society, with the support of the Cultural Institute and Sands China
The history serpes through the stalage street since the end of the nineteenth century. The narrow artery has always been the scene of an intense social and commercial rebolement and it was where Sun Yat-Sen, considered the father of modern China and the Republican Revolution, opened pharmacies and drugstores, especially from 1893. Over the years, Rua das Estalagem, in Porto, was a living example of commerce, and the Portuguese governors were progressively expanding the street, composed of the street Chinese -style buildings and temples, such as the Temple of the Bazaar and Goddess Temple NOVA WO. All these pieces of history are now counting on the digital publication “In Search of Its Roots - An Illustrated History of Rua das Estlagês”, a work produced by the Society of Macao Artists and authored by Siguo Chen in Shirley Lule's texts and illustrations. Those responsible for the edition are the Cultural Institute (IC) and the game operator Sands China. According to a press release of Sands China, the book, in Chinese and English, intends to “highlight the fascinating past of the historic Macau Street and the beauty of its legacy”, containing interviews with street -related figures, whether merchants or residents. Thus, it is intended to bring “residents and visitors to rediscover the preciousness of the centenary stores and the cultural heritage of the street through legendary stories” so that they can “widen their understanding of the transformation of the neighborhood and its inhabitants”. The content of the book results from “close conversations with representatives of associations, business entities and residents of the neighborhood,” having dozens of oral stories that can easily be lost if not recorded. This work is not closed in the digital world, having been printed to appear in the public libraries of Macao and schools, in order to “promote the meaning of cultural heritage and enhance mutual ties among the people of Macao”, intending to be “a valuable community resource to deepen the understanding and appreciation of Macao and the street”. 200 years of history One of the highlights given in the book is to the textile sector that has always predominated on Rua das Estlagenas. In the chapter entitled "Two Centuries of Prosperity: Spinning A Legacy in the Textiles Trade" [two centuries of prosperity: the construction of a legacy in the textile trade], it is read that "Street of Estlagins has always been a center for the textile industry." In the years when the textile sector had a larger presence in the territory, between the 70's and 90's, "Rua housed more than 20 stores with factory products, including three spaces from the Veng On Farm Store." “Around 30 businesses related to these stores, such as tailors, clothing stores, western products and funeral ornament stores, which brought a reputation to the street,” he reads. In Rua das Estlagenas “Tissue trade is over 200 years old,” says the same text. Other chapters of the book speak of the presence of the republican revolutionary in Macao in “The Starting Point of Sun Yat-Sen’s Story” [The Starting Point of the story of Sun Yat-Sen] or stories of street-linked personalities and their commerce. In the conclusion of the work, it refers that after the transition, the street "faced new challenges: the global financial crisis, the SARS epidemic, the COVID-19, and the uncertainty of the economy, leaving the need for renewal again." "In the past, the business has flourished, by themselves, thanks to hard work and resilience. But nowadays the community joins with a shared vision, actively planning [the development of the street] with the support of the Macao government and the integrated resort companies. With these efforts, there is a sense of hope that the street of the stalage will briefly recover its old vitality, being ready for a new era." Institutional view IC President Deland Leong Wai Man pointed out that the book results from the “weighted effort to widen the discussion around preservation and revitalization [of the street],” according to the same press release. "Street renewal is expected to inspire more people to learn about the historic neighborhoods of Macao and participate in their preservation, combining ideas and resources to ensure that the city's culture and history continue to prosper during generations," he said. In turn, Wilfred Wong, CEO of Sands China, argued that "Street of Estalagues is a microcosm of Macao itself, a place where a rich story meets a modern future." "The walls of their alleys witnessed the transformation of Macao, and their stories and people deserve to be remembered, as they are precious sources of Macao's cultural heritage. Our effort to publish the book was possible thanks to the collaboration of our local team to conduct interviews with owners of historical stores, create illustrations and take pictures, among other works," he said. New facades It is recalled that this publication arises after the Government was announced by the Sands performance at the Rua das Estalagens Revitalization Plan, namely with the “Entrepreneurs Recruitment Program for Rua das Estlagês”, launched in April last year. The game operator explains that the seven businesses selected for the initiative “have been opening through phases, bringing energy to the zone along with other new businesses, providing a platform for young ambitious entrepreneurs to realize their dreams”. In addition, the game operator intends to revitalize stores' façades “with drawings that enhance their characteristics, resonating the history of the street and the city”. For this initiative, Sands has also collaborated with the Macao Artist Society, and the drawings will be created by two young local artists, Chek On Law and Sit Kat Kit. "The aim is that, with a collective effort like this, the community can rediscover the history of the street and learn about its past stories and stores through the visual interpretations of these local artists from Macao and their perceptions of the territory," he reads. Siguo Chen, the book's author, is a veteran journalist with a career of over 60 years who has been deeply linked to the media area in Macau and Hong Kong.

item.title: Public Hiring | New regime “is on the good way,” says lawyer
item.description:
Marco Caldeira, a lawyer and auxiliary teacher at the University of Lisbon Faculty of Law, argues that the proposed public hiring law, under analysis in the specialty in Hemiciclo, is “on the good way” regarding the attempt to “promote transparency and competition and bet on digitization”. The theme was discussed last week at the Macau Scientific and Cultural Center
The proposal of public hiring, currently under analysis in the specialty in the First Permanent Commission of the Legislative Assembly (AL), was one of the topics addressed in the “Spring Conferences”, at the Macao Scientific and Cultural Center (CCCM) last week. The author of the lecture, the lawyer and teacher Marco Caldeira, made praise for the diploma for his attempt to reform and innovation in many respects. "Although not perfect, the bill under discussion is justified by the need to update legislation that was approved four decades ago. It is a proposal that seems to point in the good way, with an effort to codify the regime, promote transparency and competition and bet on digitization," said the professor at the University of Lisbon Law School (FDUL) to HM. In addition, Marco Caldeira understands that the diploma, and the content proposed by the government, aims to "follow what are good practices adopted in Europe and the West in general." "It is also very commendable that the proposal was prepared following a serious and participated procedure of public consultation, which gave the opportunity to economic operators and contracting entities to identify deficiencies in current legislation and make suggestions," added Marco Caldeira. At the CCCM session, the FDUL professor also pointed out that the concern [demonstrated, in the diploma] with the competition and transparency of the procedures ”, as well as“ the focus on training in the use of databases, as well as the focus on centralization ”. The teacher also understood that, in this bill, the Portuguese regime "can help, because the practice followed in Portugal, and legislative evolutions, have useful teachings that, with proper adaptations, can be transposed to Macao." Positive points In the presentation at CCCM, Marco Caldeira highlighted several positive aspects of the current law proposal, namely “the express determination of inapplicability to certain contracts”, or the fact that “fundamental principles of public hiring” are established. It is also required with the new law “qualifications to candidates and competitors” of public tenders, and there is also “the clarification and standardization of the types of public hiring procedures”. Thus, a “centralized hiring regime” is created, as well as regulating “award criteria” in competitions, and the creation of an exclusive website for the public hiring area is also foreseen. Marco Caldeira also drew attention to the real need of this diploma, as public hiring was legislated with various diplomas, including two decrees of 1984 and 1985, which established, respectively, the expenditure regime with works and service acquisitions, and the process of acquisition of goods and services. Such diplomas were “undone of reality” of Macao, even though the 1984 decree was reviewed in 2021, the teacher considered. Marco Caldeira also considered that the process of reviewing this diploma has been “lengthy”, as the public consultation took place between November 6, 2018 and January 4, 2019, and a later report was prepared, but the truth is that the proposal has been under analysis since December 2023, having been voted generally on January 11 last year. What has to change In the same session, the causal and university professor also highlighted the points already addressed by the first Standing Commission of AL regarding the necessary changes to legislate in the area of ​​public hiring. It was imposed “expressly consecrating fundamental legal principles, such as economy, efficiency and effectiveness, as well as publicity and transparency”, and there is also “a lack of regulation of public hiring policies”. There was also the “need to promote transparency in public hiring procedures” and ensure “greater protection of loyal competition”. There was also “lack of rigorous and explicit regulation on the composition and operation of the proposals evaluation committees” submitted to a public tender, and there is “lack of explicit demands on the qualifications and capabilities of candidates and competitors in hiring procedures”. Other gaps point to “insufficient regulation and transparency in the evaluation and adjudication procedures”, or “lack of explicit regulation on proposals presentation with an abnormally low price”. It was still necessary to “improve the sanctioning and inspection regime”, as well as bet on “regulation that promotes the development of electronic hiring”. Says the executive Looking at the justification of the law proposal, submitted by the Executive to AL, it is read that one of the great reasons for his presentation was even the legislative dispersion that was verified and the misfit over the current reality. "The nuclear part of these diplomas was prepared in the mid-1980s, and has been in force for over 30 years. A significant part of the provisions of other legal diplomas already has an obvious divergence regarding the needs of Macao's current socioeconomic development, the efficiency of public administration management and the reinforcement of transparency and supervision," he reads. According to the executive, "given that public hiring involves the use of the public purse, it is essential to review these regimes in order to meet the needs of the society of our day." Thus, in this law proposal, “the process and regime of expenses and acquisitions of goods and services” are regulated, with some provisions of a 1999 law, as “the provisions related to the public works contract regime have a high degree of specialization and are still effective”. It is intended, with the new law of public hiring, to “guarantee justice, impartiality in the evaluation of proposals”, defining “expressly aid criteria and rigorously determining the rules of conduct of workers and members of the opening and evaluation of proposals” subjected to contest, so that “excerpt their functions impartially and entirely”. Thus, it is foreseen that “contracting entities must adequately publicize the informative elements related to public hiring procedures”. They are “those related to the public tender, the clarifications provided, the rectification of documents, the extension of the deadline for the presentation of proposals, the causes for non -adjudication, the decision to annul the procedure and the award decision”. In order to guarantee loyal competition, the government wants to ensure that all entities interested in participating in a competition have “the broader access” to all procedures, prohibiting “all acts, agreements or practices that can prevent, false or restrict competition”. Moreover, there is the “principle of impartiality”, which determines that “the program of procedures, book of charges or other documents, made by the contracting party, cannot contain any clause designed to favor or harm a particular interested party”.

item.title: Sun Yat-Sen | Marked centenary of the death of the “father of modern China”
item.description:
Sun Yat-Sen died on March 12, 1925. Unavoidable figure in the political history of modern China and the father of the movement that led to the fall of the imperial regime, Sun Yat-Sen was celebrated yesterday in Guangzhou, where he was born, Beijing and Taiwan
The first president of China post-imperial and considered the father of the country's modern era, Sun Yat-Sen, was remembered yesterday in mainland China and Taiwan, the 100th anniversary of his death. In Beijing, there was a “brief and solemn ceremony” of honor to Sun in Beijing Park that has its name. Authorities and “people from all the sectors of society” were present, kept silence and made three venias in front of their statue, the Xinhua official news agency said. The Chinese Academy of History praised the political figure in his Weibo account, describing him as "a great national hero, a great patriot and a major precursor of the Democratic Revolution of China." The city of Guangzhou, the capital of Guangdong Province, where Sun Yat-Sen was born, inaugurated on Tuesday an exhibition of old objects related to the man who was one of the promoters of the revolution that overthrew the Qing Dynasty (1644-1911). The Sun Yat-Sen Memorial Building in the city welcomed the first performance of a musical based on the revolutionary's youth. In Guangzhou, where there is also a university named Sun Yat-Sen, this exhibition is exhibited, which includes objects such as the Sun Yat-Sen Graduation Exam report at the College of Medicine for Chinese, in Hong Kong, from 1892. The certificate of marriage between Sun Yat-Sen and Soong Ching-Ling is also highlighted in 1915, a woman later, woman later, Vice-President of China during the government of Mao Tse-Tung, embracing communism. In the same exhibition you can also see the bronze bust of Sun Yat-Sem itself, made by order of the Japanese friend Umeya Shokichi in 1929. The "father" of modern China was also remembered in Taiwan, with a ceremony by the Sun Yat-sen memorial in Taipei, where flowers were deposited and express respect. Double memories Despite founding, in 1919, the Kuomitang, which would become the main rival of the Chinese Communist Party (CCP), Sun is remembered in both mainland China and Taiwan. The Board of State's Taiwan Cabinet stated that Sun Yat-Sen “sought China's national unity and revitalization throughout his life,” appealing at the same time to the “compatriots of Taiwan to join us in the inheritance of his legacy” and to “oppose secession” of the island. Born in 1866, Sun studied medicine in Hong Kong - then a British colony - and, after leading several revolts, gained notoriety as a revolutionary leader and as a driving force of an attempt to modernize the country. In 1911, the Xinhai Revolution led to the fall of the Qing and Sun Yat-Sen dynasty was appointed provisional president of the New Republic of China in January 1912, but quickly gave power to the country's main military leader, Yuan Shikai, who, far from consolidating republican ideals, dissolved the parliament in 1914 and proclaimed herself in 1915, annulling Grande, annul Part of the democratic progress by which Sun had fought. From then on, he continued to promote his ideal of a unified and republican China, reorganizing the KMT and seeking international support for his cause. In 1923, he established an alliance with the newly founded CCP and received the support of the Soviet Union to reinforce the political movement. However, he failed to consolidate a stable government before his death in 1925. A LIFE OF FIGHT In the work “Sisters Soong-the oldest, younger and redest,” by Jung Chang, some details of Sun Yat-Sen's life are described before embracing the revolutionary cause and the way he left his parents' house in Guangzhou, looking for a better life. The place of destination was Hawaii, which on July 4, 1894 declared itself as a Republic, an event that, according to the book, "helped shape today's China." “A 27-year-old radical Chinese, Sun Yat-sen, landed in the archipelago and entered a world where the word 'republic' was in every mouth,” he is described. In China, the agitation against the power of the empire became strong. The Republic "was a new concept," for "the monarchy was the only political system that China knew." "At the time, the country was governed by the Manchu dynasty," the Manchus "were not natural from China, but they had conquered the territory in the mid -seventeenth century." "Since they did not get more than one percent of the population, they were considered a minority of foreign rulers and had never been lacking opposition from the native rebels Han. Sun was one of them," he describes in the same work. Sun Yat-Sen was "a low, dark man with well-proposed and pleasant traits." Its home village, Cuiheng, had soils inappropriate for agriculture, which provided “a life of extreme misery” to those who lived there. As such, the revolutionary's family did not escape adverse conditions. In his first escape from the context of poverty, Sun went to Hong Kong, finding shelter to the diocesan school and boys orphanage, then accepted a marriage arranged by the family as a gimmick to return to the village. Sun Yat-Sen married Mu-Zhen, had children, but was an absent figure and something carefree in the face of family responsibilities, traveling the world to seek support for the revolution he wanted for China. Jung Chang's work describes how Sun's course linked to the "three sisters," Ei-Ling, May-Ling and Ching-Ling. Charlie Soong funded and supported Sun Yat-Sen in her revolutionary causes, one of her daughters, Ei-Ling, became the republican secretary. This, although married, had made attempts to approach loving and EI-Ling, but eventually had a relationship with Ching-Ling, who was nationalist, but later embraced communism, being known as the "red sister." Ching-ling was also known as the Madame Sun Yat-Sen, but at the time of Sun Yat-Sen's death, the relationship between them had cooled. After the establishment of the Popular Republic of China, Ching-Ling was vice president of the country, between 1949 and 1954, and then between 1959 and 1975, and was vice president of the Permanent Commission of the National Assembly. Passage through macau Moreover, Sun Yat-Sen's life crossed Macao several times, where he lived a short time, unlike his woman, Mu-Zhen, and the children who remained in the territory longer. To remember the short period in which the Republican lived in the territory, at the time under Portuguese administration, the memorial house of dr. Sun Yat-Sen, where he "witnesses the short but significant stay in Macao in the early twentieth century when, running away from the power of imperial mandarins, tried to move his supporters forces in order to implement a new regime in China." “In Macau received support from some friends who were illustrious and influential figures of social and political life at the time,” reads the description of the museum. Another interesting detail of the 1911 Republican Revolution is the proximity of dates against the establishment of the Republic in Portugal, which took place on October 5, 1910. Macau, in the midst of events in China and Portugal, was only aware that the constitutional monarchy had fallen into Lisbon thanks to the sending of a telegram published in an official bulletin on October 10, 1910, changing the governor in this context.
