item.title: Clinical Psychology | The benefits and risks of the introduction of AI
item.description:
Artificial intelligence is there to stay and its use in the field of psychology begins to be spoken. Recently, Deputy Lam Lon Wai defended its use and, in Portugal, the Order of Psychologists created the “PSIA” platform, which allows it to detect symptoms. Nuno Gomes and Goreti Lima, two resident therapists, talk about the benefits, risks and potential uses of technology
Understanding whether emotions can result in psychological forum diseases is something that is already possible to do using Artificial Intelligence (AI). The issue begins to discuss in Macao still shyly, namely through Deputy Lam Lon Wai, who in February interpelled the government about the need to apply AI tools in clinical cases with young people. HM spoke to two clinical psychologists who work with residents of Macao, in person or distance, about the benefits and risks of betting on AI. Nuno Gomes, a psychologist in a local clinic, says that “is, for now, a help, and it will always be”. "AI is an irreversible process and it is inevitable that it covers all fields of our lives, and in them is psychology and helps people. But I come from a field of psychology that is the humanist school, which is based on the relationship with the patient, so I see no great benefits, for the use of AI, because in human relationships AI does not enter," he defended. Nuno Gomes believes that AI can help in the diagnostic phase, although he thinks "the psychologist will always be the central character." "AI can be an advantage in Macao for people who have difficulty asking for help. The use of the well -defined AI, even in ethical terms, can be very useful for the beginning of a therapy. However, at this time we are not able to use AI at the level of a more complete and background therapy," he said. Nuno Gomes also recalls that for those who want to talk to someone, AI "can give the feeling that we are not alone and that is someone on the other side." It is a feeling that is still "strange", but "in the future will no longer be, because AI will be part of our days." The psychologist believes that AI "may work as long as it is ethically well regulated and can help in brief therapies, but always as a complement to a larger process." Goreti Lima, who has lived in Macao, continues to do clinical psychology at a distance with residents living in the territory. It is more skeptical in relation to the use of AI, arguing that human relationship is always fundamental for quality monitoring. “Therapy is done in the relationship and these applications do not contemplate it. I think we can use AI to diagnose, see symptoms, but this we can also do with a book or article. ChatgPT already tells us some things in the area of ​​psychology, possible analysis of symptoms. AI helps in this process, but then the rest works in the therapeutic relationship. Data are stored like? Recommendations in Portugal In a written interpeação directed to the Government of MSAR, Deputy Lam Lon Wai questioned whether there will be “cooperation” between government departments, technological companies and local academic institutions in the use of AI in the area of ​​mental health. However, Goreti Lam regrets that deputy "do not speak in the figure of the psychologist." “Academics have a different experience from psychologists and therapists, who have acquired this experience in practical terms. This develops over time. All these questions have to be thought when applying AI. AI can identify what the person has and even use, but then we have to take into account deontological conditions. Undersisted, ”he added. Portugal is one of the countries where the application of AI in Psychology begins to gain some form, to the point of the Order of Portuguese Psychologists (OPP) has created the online “Psia” tool, which allows you to state a series of symptoms and reach a diagnosis. Personal data appear to be protected with the introduction, on the website, the citizen card number, with the digital mobile key. In addition, OPP has created a manual of good practices, entitled “The Human Factor in Artificial Intelligence - Strategic Recommendations for Sustainability”, which states that there are “virtual therapists who can identify, in communication with people, emotional difficulties that facilitate deliberate psychological education”, as well as enhancing “the learning of techniques and skills that aim, for example, to reduce anxiety”. In addition, the OPP document concludes that "some studies suggest that these chatbots, developed based on validated therapeutic models, may be effective in reducing depressive symptoms and even that some people establish a bond similar to that of a human relationship." However, “these evidence is not consolidated and security-related (people and data), eventual dependence on technologies and the responsiveness of support given to different psychological difficulties are not clarified”, it reads. Regarding PSIA, it is referred to the OPP website that "on very specific or complex issues should not be used in tasks that require specialized judgment and evaluation, deep technical analysis or professional counseling." It is also clarified that the answers provided are based on “available documents and information” until July 31 last year, and PSIA “does not replace the role of a psychologist or any supervision activities”. In the case of Hong Kong, some solutions are also beginning to emerge, which motivated, by the way, the interpellation of Deputy Lam Lon Wai. This is the case of Hollo, a mobile phone application developed in connection with the University of Hong Kong (UHK) that aims to “make mental health care more accessible to patients, service platforms and organizations”. Hollo uses AI power and technologies to bring clinical practices standardized to another level of productivity, intelligence and digital connectivity. According to Cameron Van Breda, Hollo's CEO and co-founder, the company aims to be "an easily accessible tool in stress times, offering analysis and friendship suggestions for better mental health exercises." In practical terms, “focuses on young people from 12 to 24 years old, works in English and Chinese and introduce them to therapy and counseling practices through mindfulness activities and daily games,” reads UHK's website. Almost the same Asked about Macao's mental health landscape, Nuno Gomes understands that he persists "some conservatism and ignorance not only in what is AI and areas where one can apply, but also what psychology can do." "Psychology is here to help people and in the context of Macao there is no such understanding yet. This stigma prevents many people from seeking help and AI can give this support. However, the older population is still very unaware of the operation of AI, but the younger people will increasingly resort to this type of platforms," ​​he said. In general terms, "the overview of mental health has changed little from the pandemic," because "in general, people do not feel the need to express emotions and since they are encouraged to keep emotions, that when they are bad and stored a long time, they start to do harm. People do not know how to express them out of shame or guilt." Goreti Lima also understands that in the area of ​​mental health there is still some ignorance in Macau.

item.title: Architecture | Liu Jiakun won Pritzker 2025 prize
item.description:
Liu Jiakun won this year's Pritzker Prize. Chengdu's natural architect was chosen by the work “coherent”, in peace with nature and the surrounding world. The organization of the prize highlights the “path that was neither linear nor expected”, and architectural projects with “convincing answers” ​​in environmental terms
In Liu Jiakun's work is the citizen who rules, without fixed lines or barriers, combining the old and the modern. But above all, there is a kind of consistency. The Chinese architect, born in 1956 in Chengdu province, won this year's Pritzker Prize, a distinction often described as the Nobel Prize in Architecture. With this week's announcement, the point that was missing to consecrate the talent of a man who lived and worked in a changing China was added and who narrowly did not give up architecture. By the way, according to the official information of the Pritzker Award on Liu Jiakun, his journey “until architecture was neither linear nor expected”. The mother was an internal doctor at Chengdu Second People's Hospital and it was there that much of her days spent during her childhood. In the years when China lived intensely Maoism and then during the process of reform and openness, Liu underwent all political and social transformations as it grew. He attended the program for “educated young people” in the area of ​​agriculture, and then the Chongqing Institute of Architecture and Engineering, later called the University of Chongqing University in 1978. “As in a dream, I suddenly realized that my life was important,” he said, according to the official information of the Pritzker award. The studio in his own name, Jiakun Architects, only emerged in 1999 in his hometown, Chengdu, the capital of Sichuan province. About himself and his work, Liu Jiakun said: "Aspire always being like water-permeating a place without having a fixed shape of his own and infiltrating me in the local environment and in the place itself." "Over time, water gradually solidifies, becoming architecture and perhaps even the highest form of human spiritual creation. However, it maintains all the qualities of this place, both good and bad," he added. Regarding the attribution of Pritzker, the jury considered that the Chinese architect knew how to innovate, keeping the side more traditional than the profession can have. "Identity has as much to do with the individual and with the collective meaning of belonging to a place. Liu Jiakun revisits the Chinese tradition without nostalgic approach or ambiguity, but as a trampoline for innovation. Creating a new architecture that is simultaneously historical record, an infrastructure, a landscape and a remarkable public space," says the organization. Spatial commitment Building houses or buildings can be much more than simple building, establishing a commitment to space and the environment. For the Pritzker jury, "in a global context where architecture strives to find adequate answers to rapidly evolving social challenges, Liu Jiakun gave convincing answers that also celebrate people's daily lives as well as their community and spiritual identities." Also according to the jury, "through a remarkable work of deep consistency and constant quality, Liu Jiakun imagines and builds new worlds, free from any aesthetic or stylistic embarrassment." “Instead of a style, it has developed a strategy that is never based on a recurring method, but rather the evaluation of the specific characteristics and demands of each project differently. That is, Liu Jiakun takes the current realities and manipulates them to the point of offering a totally new scenario of everyday life. In addition to knowledge and technique, it adds common sense and wisdom to the designer's tool box,” he adds. The note that presented the award states that the architect can project “a built environment that is often being pulled in opposite directions”, rethinking “the foundations of density through cohabitation, creating an intelligent solution that balances the opposite forces at stake”. The jury also describes that "through a remarkable work of deep consistency and constant quality, Liu Jiakun imagines and builds new worlds, free from any aesthetic or stylistic embarrassment." The largest projects This year's Pritzker statement highlights the “West Village” project in Chengdu, classified as “transformative”, where Liu Jiakun knew “reformulate the paradigm of public spaces and community life”, “inventing new independent and shared forms of living together, where density does not represent the opposite of an open system”. The architect created here a space that allows "adaptation, expansion and replicability." Also noteworthy are “subtle and memorable museums” created by themselves, such as the Suzhou Museum of Imperial Kiln Brick or the Shuijingfang Museum, also in Chengdu. In turn, at the Huishan Memorial in Chengdu, the architect "understands that identity is a matter of collective and personal memory, brilliantly raising the individual perspective to a fundamental element of place creation in order to revive a community dimension." Degree in 1982, Liu was part of the first generation of students responsible for the major projects of the so -called “Nova China”, already with Deng Xiaoping to the rudder of the central government. At the beginning of his career, he was linked to Chengdu's Institute for Research and Architectural Design, a state-owned entity, having moved to Nagqu in Tibeta, where he lived two years in the 1980s. About this time, the architect recalled his “greatest strength at the time seemed to be my fear of nothing, beyond the abilities of painting and writing,” pionering books and writing at night when he did not project. His career in architecture was almost set aside until Liu Jiakun saw Tang Hua's solo architecture exhibition, a former university colleague at the Shanghai Art Museum in 1993. Such “rekindled his passion for the profession and fueled a new mindset that he could also be diverted from prescribed social aesthetics,” describes the pritzker jury. For Liu, "architecture must reveal something - abstract, distill and make visible the qualities inherent to local people," "the power to shape human behavior and create atmospheres, offering a sense of serenity and poetry, evoking compassion and mercy, and cultivating a meaning of shared community."

item.title: Elections | Council of Communities defends electronic vote
item.description: The president of the Regional Council of Portuguese Communities of Asia and Oceania, Rui Marcelo, defended the electronic vote to facilitate the participation of emigrants in the elections. "The electronic vote has been a flag of the Portuguese Communities Council there are already several mandates, because it has not been a consensual theme, I would say, with the Portuguese government authorities and with parliamentary groups," said Rui Marcelo, when asked by Lusa. "We have been discussing this possibility with the Portuguese authorities and, for our part, the process would have been accelerated," he said. Rui Marcelo spoke to journalists at the end of the meeting of the Regional Council of the Portuguese Communities of Asia and Oceania (which includes China, Thailand, South Korea, Japan, Singapore, Australia and Timor-Leste), which took place at Dili last week. Although correspondence vote was the normal procedure, the official said that there are “always problems regarding the dates on which these votes eventually arrive at the National Election Commission”, noting that the next legislatures, scheduled for May 18, will “create very important challenges in the participation process”. In February, Parliament approved a resolution presented by the PSD to carry out an experience to test the electronic vote in emigration. During the two days of the meeting, the counselors also discussed forms of cooperation between the circles in the education and associativism sector, in the area of ​​economics and consular issues and on artistic and cultural potentialities.

item.title: Diplomacy | Paulo Rangel has a meeting with Sam Hou Fai on Friday
item.description:
The Minister of State and Foreign Affairs visits China this week, on a four -day trip that includes contacts with Chinese government representatives and a stint at Macao. Paulo Rangel's agenda includes a meeting with Sam Hou Fai and the visit to the Portuguese School of Macau
Portuguese Minister of State and Foreign Affairs, Paulo Rangel, begins a visit to China that will include a time at Macau and Hong Kong on Friday, the last day of the ticket to China. At Mishes, the Portuguese politician will meet representatives of associations, educational institutions and entrepreneurs and will visit the Portuguese School of Macao. Paulo Rangel will meet equally with the head of the Executive of the MSAR, Sam Hou Fai, and the advisers of the Portuguese communities elected by the Circle of China (China, Korea, Japan, Singapore and Thailand). The official program of Paulo Rangel's visit ends with a visit to the exhibition “Stories Lusas”, an initiative dedicated to the Portuguese community, at the Hong Kong History Museum. Departure house However, before heading to Macau, the agenda of the head of Portuguese diplomacy starts tomorrow in Beijing, at 10am, with a meeting with the director general of the international department of the Chinese Communist Party, Minister Liu Jinchao, indicates a statement released on Friday by the ministry protected by Rangel. There is a meeting with Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi and a meeting with Beijing Foreign Studies University, Jia Wenjian. Still in the Chinese capital, Paulo Rangel will give a lecture at Beijing Foreign Studies University (BFSU) subordinate to the theme “Portuguese Language and Culture”. The next day, already in Haikou (southern China), the Portuguese minister intervenes in the "Boa Forum Forum for Asia 2025", the annual conference held in the Chinese province of Haião that aims to promote and deepen the exchange, coordination and economic cooperation between Asia and other parts of the world. item.title: Gas | Ron Lam asks for more regulation of facilities
item.description: Deputy Ron Lam considers that the government should follow Hong Kong's example and create regulation that defines the qualifications of gas equipment supervision technicians. The position was taken through a written interpellation signed by the deputy. Lam recalled that currently in Macau there are only laws that regulate entities that install gas equipment, but there are no rules on the qualifications of technical personnel, who do not have to take any exam or get a certificate of access to the profession. The deputy also wants to know if after the explosion accident in Toi San, which caused injuries to two children and one maid, if the authorities investigated the gas equipment. In addition, the deputy asks the government to explain that measures will be adopted to avoid their incidents in the future.

item.title: Hengqin | Sam Hou Fai calls for more efforts and reform spirit
item.description:
The priority to realize the development of the in -depth cooperation zone involves the study of the spirit of Xi Jinping's discourses. This is one of the four expectations presented by the Chief Executive for the in -depth cooperation zone
The learning of the “Macau + Hengqin” concept presented by Xi Jinping is the priority in the development of the deepened cooperation zone between Canton and Macao in Hengqin. The goal was outlined by Sam Hou Fai, chief executive and co-chief of the deepened cooperation zone management committee during the latest working meeting on Saturday. About the “next phase of development” of the cooperation zone, Sam Hou Fai presented four “expectations” to guide the work. The first is to “seriously learn and implement the important approach‘ Macau + Hengqin ’” presented by President XI Jinping, and “deeply understand its rich connotations and practical requirements, making all efforts to create a new conjuncture of the cooperation zone”. In the official version of the meeting issued by the Macao government, the “important approach” is not explained, nor are the “connotations” and “practical requirements” specifically indicated. As a second expectation, Sam asked the members of the Commission "more efforts to reform and innovation" of the cooperation zone, and the willingness to "courageously exploit innovative policies and the convergence of rules and mechanisms, to overcome hengqin development restrictions." Also in this regard, the “restrictions” that have been found were not detailed. As a third expectancy, the Macao government leader asked for a reinforcement of the ability to work and willingness to "achieve advances." Finally, Sam considered that Macau has to reinforce support to the authorities across the border to promote "new achievements in all strands." Positive balance Looking at the work of the last three years, Sam Hou Fai considers that they have been achieved "positive progress" and that "the level of integration between Hengqin and Macau has gradually improved." The chief executive also argued that the role of the cooperation zone as a support of “diversified development of the economy of Macao is becoming increasingly evident”. In turn, Guangdong Province Governor Wang Weizhong, the other co-chief of the in-depth cooperation zone, said the commission will “strive to develop the four new industries, to enhance the Guangdong-Macau Circuit Design Park in Hengqin, the Chinese Traditional Medicine Park, the Transfronho Electronic Trade Industrial Park. and the Innovation Industrial Park Hengqin-Macau ”. In addition, he pointed out as priority works, the reinforcement of “dissemination and promotion of preferred policies and the planning and introduction of industrial projects”, as well as the attraction of “more qualified frames with innovative ideas, capital, companies and residents of Macao to animate the business environment of the cooperation zone”.

item.title: Commerce | Lao Ngai Leong wants more vehicles from Hong Kong
item.description:
With local commerce to lose more and more revenues to the interior, the member of the National Popular Assembly for Macau suggests that the territory accepts more Hong Kong vehicles, to help the recovery of business with small and medium enterprises
The member of the Macao National Popular Assembly, Lao Ngai Leong, suggests the attribution of more quotas for Hong Kong vehicles can circulate in Macao, to compensate for small and medium -sized companies (SMEs), by loss of interior revenue. The proposal was presented during a session to learn the “spirit of the two sessions”, held Association of Federation and Commercial Union of Shun de Macao, on Wednesday. During the session, according to the Citizen Journal, Lao Ngai Leong addressed local trade problems, caused by increasingly frequent consumption of residents across the border. However, Lao pointed out that the issue is broader and has advantages, as “small and medium -sized companies also started consuming more in the north”. Despite this scenario, the entrepreneur expects Guangdong vehicles to circulate getting closer to Macau to visit the territory and increase the volume of SMEs. However, the politician warned the local population of the need to have greater ability to accept the increase in traffic on the Macao roads. The suggestion was presented at a time when Hong Kong residents tend to consume more and more inside, especially in Shenzhen, where prices are cheaper than Raehk or Macao. To recognize reality Regarding the SMEs of community neighborhoods, the deputy recognized the existence of added difficulties, since the new Zhuhai tourists do not stay, nor buy in these zones. Lao Ngai Leong defended so that the government has to create other attractions in the neighborhoods and assign greater support to local commerce to cross this complicated phase. Despite the difficulties, the businessman argued that Macau's economy is "recovering relatively well after the pandemic" and that it is the "obligation of all sectors to take advantage of the central government's preferred policies." item.title: China | Residents may require online travel authorizations
item.description: The central government announced yesterday two new measures to facilitate travel and residence fixation in the interior of China for residents of Macau, Hong Kong and Taiwan. The measures announced by the National Immigration Administration (NIA) immediately entered into force. One of them allows residents of the three regions to request a temporary authorization valid for seven days that enables the shipment on flights and trains in Chinese cities if residents lose, damage or forget their travel authorizations (saved conduct). According to the statement published yesterday by NIA, a check service that connects travel and residence permits was also launched. Residents may request proof of the association of two authorizations through an online NIA platform or obtain an official paper document on any immigration service inside China. In addition, government agencies and companies that provide services to residents of Hong Kong, Macau and Taiwan began to integrate their systems on the NIA authentication platform for automatic verification. In the statement released yesterday, immigration administration "has committed to further improve immigration policies, widening the accessibility of services and providing more adapted support to make life easier and development of residents of Hong Kong, Macao and Taiwan on the continent."

item.title: Let us be practical
item.description: The annual plenary session of the National Popular Congress and the National Committee of the Chinese people's Political Advisory Conference, held in Beijing, has recently ended. One of the main concerns of Macau representatives was the “Integration of Macao and Hengqin”. I transcribe an excerpt from a conversation I heard as I had breakfast, "Are you going to buy an apartment in Hengqin?" "No, if I wanted a house, I bought it in Zhuhai, because it gets closer to Macau." Living in Hengqin certainly has its advantages. Many students from China who study at Macao universities live in Hengqin and catch the bus to the mud every day. There are also many residents and newly arrived people living in Hengqin for reasons related to work or children's school. But even if they come to live in Hengqin, which has an area of ​​106.46 square kilometers, 100,000 people, or even more than 200,000, is still not much. At the time when the housing fractions of the “new neighborhood of Macau” were for sale, there were many restrictions, which were being raised over time on the grounds of “development policy changes with development”. But deep down, they are "policies that give in to reality." In fact, whether it is politics or economics, the practical sense is imposed. I am not opposed to the improvement of the legal framework aimed at the “integration of Macao and Hengqin,” as it is necessary to clarify the difference between “in -depth cooperation zone between Guangdong and Macau in Hengqin” and “New Zone of Hengqin”. If we think about the efforts that are being developed for the “integration of Macao and Hengqin,” we will see that Macau has played a more active role than Guangdong Province. In the case of Macao, I suggest that hengqin circulation of all types of vehicles from the city is allowed. However, how can Hengqin attract residents of Macao to live there and contribute to their development if there is not even a public parking park for Macao vehicles at the Hengqin border post? If there are those who ask that the “Macao vehicle circulation policy in Guangdong province” has already made it difficult to survive companies in the North Zone of Macao, then if these vehicles are allowed to circulate in Hengqin, will this not even have negative consequences for Macao's economy? In my opinion, the introduction of reforms in the commercial sector is just a way to get out of your current situation. It is a priority to end the monopoly of the commercial sector, to open the economy to different markets, to develop and use the unoccupied land as much as possible, while reducing the negative impact of “road works” on companies and store owners. For example, the Jockey Club of Macao has been closed since last year and the clues have been covered with grass. However, the Macao government has not announced any development plan for the site, thus being wasted valuable resources. Perhaps the Macao government can be inspired by the operational management of Hong Kong's “Kai Tak Sports Park”. As for this subject, the Macao Executive can grant one of six resort and leisure companies integrated the Jockey Club's land development and management rights for a given period of time, which can somehow help create a new commercial zone that attracts the consumption of more tourists. It would also be important to create political incentives and/or flexibility of restrictions on companies to attract traders to settle in the old neighborhoods and community neighborhoods throughout the city. If we look at the “reordering of the amendment street and four other streets of the parish of Santo António” that took place a few years ago, and compare the agitated environment that existed before and after reordering, it becomes evident that the “ideas” that come out of those who “are sitting in their offices” have to be put to the test to be effective. We impose on reality only usually results in disaster. The “Integration of Hengqin and Macau” is an ambitious venture that the homeland has entrusted to Macao. Before Hengqin is officially under the jurisdiction of Macao, the most important thing is to preserve and develop Macau.

item.title: Artificial Intelligence in Macao Culinary
item.description: "Macau's Opulent Fine Dining Scene is Using Ai to Tackle Sustainability: How Restaurants in Galaxy Macau, Sands China and Grand Lisbon Are Leading The Green March Forward." Amanda Sheppard Macao's cuisine scene, a region known for its vibrant mixture of Portuguese and Chinese influences, is taking its first steps in a technological revolution with the integration of Artificial Intelligence (IA). AI entered the world of cooking as a tool of efficiency and innovation. In Macao, a territory with a diverse culinary heritage, AI application may reshape traditional approaches to food. The fusion of advanced technology with rich culinary traditions creates a unique landscape, offering both opportunities and challenges. The historical background of the kitchen in Macau enhance the unique identity of the region. Macau was a Portuguese colony for over four centuries, creating an intricate mix of Asian and European culinary practices. This mixture formed a rich culinary tapestry, with dishes such as cod and minchi macanese to gain local and international fame. As we examine this story, we appreciate the unique features of Macao's kitchen, which AI technologies are now prepared to improve. In recent years, the growing adoption of AI technologies in the global gastronomic scene has marked a significant change. Restaurants began to use AI for various purposes, such as improving customer experience and rationalizing food preparation processes. AI -powered chatbots, for example, entered the world of food services, providing customers immediate assistance to navigate the menus, order, and make reservations. This technology eliminates linguistic barriers, allowing tourists and local inhabitants to get involved with culinary offers smoothly. In addition, the food preparation sector is watching the influence of robotics and intelligent equipment. AI algorithms can optimize cooking processes by analyzing data on ingredients, cooking times and consumer preferences. This data -based approach allows bosses to focus on creativity by minimizing the risks of human error. For example, Michelin restaurants such as Chief Tam Seasons, SJM's Robochon Au Dôme, Galaxy's Walk Kitchen and The Londoner's Churchill’s Table are all stimulating change and received praise for using AI to improve operational efficiency and maintain high food quality standards. Heads António Coelho, Sally Jimenez and Cristiano Tavares do Lisboeta study the introduction of AI into their culinary practices. Mizumi's chief André Chiang is making progress in the world of culinary with technology. Known for his innovative gastronomy approach, chief Chiang has taken advantage of AI in his culinary developments. Its Japanese restaurant at Wynn Macau uses smart technologies to improve traditional kitchen techniques. When using AI tools to analyze customer reactions and service standards, it can continually improve dining experience. The prospects for the role of AI in Macao cuisine range from the professionals of the sector. Some bosses adopt the integration of technology, facing it as a way of overcoming the boundaries of cooking. The supporters argue that AI can help maintain the cultural essence of Macaense food, while innovating with new flavors and presentation styles. By analyzing large amounts of culinary data, AI may suggest unique combinations of ingredients that could not occur to human heads. On the other hand, there are those who express concern about the potential loss of authenticity. Critics argue that trusting technology can harm traditional kitchen methods and the human touch that is an integral part of the culinary arts. Its point of view underlines the importance of preserving heritage and emotional links associated with handmade food. Despite these different perspectives, the thesis remains that AI's role in Macao's culinary industry can represent a fascinating evolution and not a substitution of human ability. (continues)

item.title: Tickets for sale since Saturday to the 35th edition of FAM
item.description: Since Saturday, tickets are for sale for the 35th edition of the Macao Arts Festival (FAM), which runs between April 25 and May 31, and this year's central theme is the idea of ​​“growth”. It is presented to the public, with organization of the Cultural Institute (IC), a set of 15 shows that cover theater, Chinese opera, dance, circus, music and visual arts. This edition of FAM starts with “The Life of Pi”, a theatrical production of West End of London and Broadway, which, with FAM, begins the first tour of East Asia in Macao. The show blends state -of -the -art techniques with impressive puppets techniques to explore the meaning of life and the theme of courage. Moreover, in order to show the idea of ​​“East-Kidade Meeting, Asia in Harmony”, linked to the “Culture City of East Asia 2025-Macao, China” initiative, two shows are presented. They are “Deling and Cixi”, a collaboration between Beijing and Hong Kong teams that recreates intimate narratives in the court's private rooms during the Qing dynasty; and also the Cantonense opera concert “Discorting Harmonious Voices”. This musical show is presented by the Chinese orchestra of Macao along with notable figures of the Cantonense opera, such as Zeng Xiaomin and Wen Ruqing, making known to Macau's public the culture of Lingnan. Another of the highlights of the 35th edition of FAM is the show “A Phoenix Louca”, from the Cantonense opera troupe of Foshan. It is an adaptation of a classic play centered on the life of the talented playwright Kong Yu-Kau, which will provide viewers with a totally new experience, maintaining the dramatic intensity of the piece and ingeniously integrating innovative elements of the Cantonense opera. Japan Premiere FAM also features the original Japanese musical “Kiki, the Apprentice of Witch”, which in Macau will have its debut outside Japan. In this show, it presents itself with a new musical repertoire and a production team that will faithfully capture the charm of the homonymous work and animation. Local audiences can also see the Tago, from South Korea, which feature “the shaman's beat”, a show that will combine traditional percussion techniques with a modern aesthetic.

item.title: World Book Day | IC organizes “Book Exchange” and various activities
item.description:
April is a month to celebrate the reading. On the 23rd, the “World Book Day” takes place, and in this context, the government, through the Cultural Institute, will organize a series of programs to promote reading, such as the exchange of old books, and other activities
The “World Book Day” is celebrated on April 23rd and, therefore, the Cultural Institute (IC) organizes activities such as the “Book Exchange”. In various places of the city there will also be reading points, in an activity designated by “joint reading month throughout the city of Macau 2025”, that is, throughout April. The “Book Exchange” initiative has begun, notably with regard to the process of collecting books that people can have in their homes and who want to exchange for others through a point system. The delivery of old works can be done until April 13, and residents can deliver their collections of books that meet the conditions required in the 11 public libraries under the IC aegis, including the Macao Central Library, the Sir Robert Ho Tung library, the mud library and the Seac Pai Van library, among others. This year, for the first time, there will be an electronic system of points, and each book will be classified according to the original price, being attributed a unit for every 10 patacas or to a fraction of not less than five patacas. The maximum score per book or collection is 100 units. In collection of electronic points, residents can use the application “my library”. The exchange of books will take place on April 26 and 27, with the points obtained to be replaced by the new works chosen, to the counters of the Macao Cultural Center and the Auditorium of the Seac Pai Van Activities Center. The IC describes that, in the book exchange system, no textbooks and textbooks, magazines, pornographic publications, damaged books or non -original books are allowed. Readings in the city Another activity of promoting the book, is the “reading points”, a program where you can register the entities or associations of the territory. The aim is to “share reading time in community neighborhoods, increase participation and broaden reading coverage to the public”. Thus, interested parties can submit their proposals for the organization of “reading points” by April 30, and these “points” can be organized in stores, restaurants, schools, educational centers, associations, companies and offices, with no format limitations. Participating entities must organize reading activities by their own initiative from April 1st to 30th and present photographs and the number of participants after the activities. Relevant photographs will be published on the thematic electronic page of libraries and on the cultural pages of IC on social networks, “so that more residents can feel the charm of reading,” explains the IC.

item.title: Jazz | “S.T.A.O. Hong Kong + MJPA” tomorrow at the Rui Cunha Foundation

Hong Kong + MJPA” to the stage of the FRC gallery to celebrate the reunion with long -time friends. item.title: Letters Route | Valério Romão presents “another disappointment” this Sunday
item.description:
“Another disappointment - first foray of a novelist in poetic creation” is the name of the event in which Valério Romão, writer and translator, presents his new and first book of poetry, or poetic writing. “Another disappointment” is a book that reflects on today's Portugal, a country with various crises, from economic to existential, in which the author debuts in a new form of writing. The presentation starts at 16h in the old slaughterhouse, in Barra
Valério Romão likes Portugal, but no longer knows why. It does not understand the feeling for a country that has been permanently in crisis, whether political or economic, for several years, and that 50 years after April 25, 1974, when the Estado Novo dictatorship fell, is still looking to meet. The identity of Portuguese is not always the most optimistic, and the country is lacking strategy to find and have a healthier existence. All of these ideas can be found in the new poetry book by Valério Romão, “another disappointment”, recently released in Portugal with the chancela of Abyssmo and will be presented this Sunday in the Rota das Letras Literary Festival, in the old slaughterhouse, in Barra. Macao is not new to Valério Romão, as it is a territory that welcomed him to a literary residence, or for previous appearances in Rota das Letras. Nevertheless, the return is always curious. “I hope to be able to talk about my latest book, and as it is an international festival, with a strong presence of Chinese writers, I want to know the work of others and widen the horizons a little,” he confessed to HM. "I do not know if Chinese culture has a declared influence on my work, but certainly has a proper influence. The writers are usually the product of their experiences, what they have gathered and lived. In this sense, Chinese culture has become central, as it shows a different way of thinking, strange and sometimes incomprehensible. But it always encourages me a tremendous curiosity," he said. New Territories Returning to the book, Valério Romão assumes that he “wanted to explore a new world in writing, especially in form”, after giving readers with novels where the family is a central theme, such as “autism” or “Joana”, which belong to a trilogy. “The ideas had been in my head for some time, but this form of writing, which some people call poetry and others, poetic prose, yes, it was a novelty. Understanding the skin of novelist was natural, because even in my prose writing I use the metaphor, comparison and style figures, and the irony too. Prose, even in an embryonic way, ”he confessed. Flame Country Valério Romão shows, in writing, the disappointment to Portugal. “I don't think it offers great living conditions. We are reconditioning the country in services, in a kind of 'Thailandization' to explore everything we can from tourists who come here, but then there are no strategic bets. I don't see great national leadership that can lead us, nor feel that there are ideas that, in a few years, can take us to another place. Dismissal, which are typically Portuguese, than properly for planning, ”he said. The author understands that the Portuguese are pessimistic, with little self-esteem, and with a greater tendency towards melancholy than for another kind of happier feelings. "We can only look at the mirror if someone puts us the mirror ahead. And it is important [this analysis] is done by historians, writers, poets, musicians. We tend to think that we are the best and, at the same time, the worst in the universe, having a fragile self-esteem and a distorted image, for good and evil, of ourselves." With “one more disappointment”, Valério Romão does not want to “do an exercise of national reflection”, which is only a “exercise of private reflection”. “I hope it contributes to more conversations and reflections,” he says. About the identity of Portuguese, "It's too much, it's very Mediterranean, but at the same time there is the fado in the genes, so faster goes to the fado than to samba." Portugal is on the tail of Europe in geographical terms and, for Valério Romão, this may be one of the factors for the country's existential crisis. "The political class is a reflection of our population and has to improve when we, as a country and Portuguese, also improve. This has to do with the dictatorship years, with the Atlantic and Central Europe, with the peripheral status of Europe. This recovery is not achieved in 50 years [of democracy], perhaps in 100, but education is missing as well." The author, who considers that, currently, "it is unusual to talk about education, because there seems to be a dictatorship of the unclear opinion," but for himself, "education is even the elevator of the individual and people." "People have economic and even existential difficulties. In the 1990s everyone wanted to send their children to college, because they thought it was guaranteed a guaranteed future, but at this time we realized that this guarantee does not exist." The author also stressed that "we are at a time when there is an anti-science, anti-academia feeling, where it is suspected of everything that comes from the academy." "We are in the paradox, where we think technology gives us access to the tree of the patacas and in which, on the other hand, consider that science is for nothing, especially the social sciences," he said. In "One more disappointment," Valério Romão confessed that he had no sense "great difference as an author in the writing of this book." "I followed the script that was being imposed, the form was adapting to the content, and vice versa. I am quite free when I write a book, in the sense that I end up not having major rules before it begins, and I have no major rules when I am writing it," he said.

item.title: Man accused of domestic violence hurts two police officers
item.description: One resident wounded two police with a knife while trying to resist a detention. The case happened on Thursday after the man was the subject of a new ex-wife complaint for two theft crimes. Already last year he had been accused of domestic violence. According to the newspaper or Mun, the Judiciary Police (PJ) was able to stop the man on Thursday after receiving a complaint for the ex-wife's theft. The alleged criminal was arrested near the vicinity of the former partner's housing. When he realized that he was going to be arrested, the man tried to escape and used a knife to resist, slightly hurting two of the agents. According to the contours of the case, after the divorce, the victim went to live alone in the Nam Van area. Man was applied as a measure of coercion the prohibition of contact with women, due to physical aggression, which will have happened in January. However, on 25 February, the suspect violated the coercion measure, and went to the victim's house to discuss money issues. That day he physically assaulted the woman, besides having pointed to him a knife. The attacker also locked the woman at home for 31 hours. Before leaving, he stole a suitcase of 9,000 patacas that was sold by the suspect in the interior of China for 2,000 Renminbis. On the 18th of this month, the man returned to his wife's house, took advantage of the fact that the door was not locked and asked him for money again. Once again he kidnapped the woman in the apartment for 15 hours, forcing her to apply for a 5,000-pass loan from a friend. The case was referred to the MP for the crimes of forbidden weapon, theft, kidnapping, resistance and coercion, qualified offense to physical integrity and domestic violence. Appeal to protection After becoming public, the General Association of Macao Women's Women came to ask the government to improve the protection measures provided for in the Domestic Violence Prevention and Combat Law. For long years, this association has taken an abstention position in the face of the possibility of allowing the police to investigate the crimes of domestic violence without a complaint of the victims. The director of the association's Lai Yuen Solidarity Center, Wong Law Law, came to the authorities to review the victims' protection measures during the proceedings that have not yet been tried, but where there were complaints, to ensure effective protection of the victims. Wong Law Lei also highlighted the need for the authorities to investigate well the reason that led to the woman had not filed a complaint earlier, tolerating the aggressions.

item.title: Technology | More families with internet access in 2024

The number of Internet users in Macau was 610,300, plus 13,000 people, a growth of 2.2 percent compared to the year 2023. item.title: Demography | Macaense population in San Francisco surpasses Macau
item.description:
A study released by a Chinese researcher concludes that, currently, the population of Macanese and Luso-Asia that resides in the area of ​​San Francisco Bay in the United States is larger than that of Macao
"There are about 70,000 macanese and Luso-Asia to reside in San Francisco, which is more than the number in Macao," researcher Leong Wong Un NA was told Lusa, who presented last Thursday at the University of Macao, the book "Macanese and Luso-Assian in the San Francisco Bay Area" from 1940 to 1950, a title that results from his doctoral thesis. According to the latest censuses held in Macao in 2021, only 13,021 residents in Macau had Portuguese ancestry, representing 1.9 percent of the total population. The data also reveal that 6,668 people, 1 percent of the total population, had Chinese and Portuguese descent, characteristics usually used to define the Macanese community. The Portuguese Leadership Council of the United States has a total population of 1,454,262 with Portuguese ancestry. According to Leong, the Macanese, some of which had departed to various regions of Asia in the nineteenth century, Luso-Asian and the Portuguese in Asia, emigrated to the United States from Macao in the twentieth century, due to political and economic reasons, choosing as the main destination of the São Francisco Bay in California. The Language Question Leong Wong Un NA, a Chinese who grew up in Macao and says maintaining a close relationship with the Macanese community, has many family members resident in San Francisco, including parents and siblings. The immigrated macanese and Luso-Asiatic-symatics in San Francisco, concluded Leong, were not soon recognized as Portuguese when they arrived in the United States and were even discriminated against for decades by the Portuguese community itself. At the same time the Communist Party was taking power in China, “the macanese and the Luso-Asiatics, when they immigrated there [San Francisco], could not participate in the organizations created by the Portuguese of Portugal,” said Leong Wong Un na. "Some of the descendants of Portuguese who came from Asia did not speak fluent Portuguese, so the Portuguese from Portugal said that if they did not know Portuguese, they were not Portuguese," he explained. Leong describes in his book not only how the community of Macaenses and Luso-Asia that is currently living in the area of ​​São Francisco Bay, such as the origins and cultural traits of the Portuguese community there and even the architectural characteristics they have imprinted on the urban surroundings. The researcher concluded that the Macaenses and Luso-Asia of San Francisco "maintain habits still very alive in Macau, such as the Macaense cuisine and the Catholic religion."

item.title: Health | Study suggests prohibition of smoking while walking on the street
item.description: Health services presented on Friday the result of a study that evaluates the application of laws that prevent and control smoking, which suggests the prohibition of smoking while walking on the street, an act that the government indicates to be "commonly designated by locomotives." item.title: Environment | Macau turned on the lights on Saturday at the “Hour of the Planet”
item.description: Macau joined the World Fund for Nature Fund campaign (WWF) on Saturday and turned on the lights for an hour in defense of the planet, the government announced on Friday. Public services, the four bridges that connect Macau's peninsula to the area of ​​the mud, six entertainment complexes and hotels, some companies, some government buildings and emblematic structures of the city go, “serving their own reality”, turning off the “unnecessary lights”, to “show the determination to protect the environment, dedicating an hour to Earth”, reads in a communication from the direction of environmental protection services. item.title: Inflation | Prices in Macau retreated 0.16% in February
item.description: The Consumer Price Index (IPC) in Macao descended in February 0.16 percent, in annual terms, announced the Directorate of Statistics and Census Services (DSEC) on Friday. The descent is due to “mainly to the high comparison base, as the occurrence of the Lunar New Year in February 2024 led to the prices of some goods/services to be at a relatively high level,” read in a DSEC statement. This year, the so -called Golden Week of the Lunar New Year caught a few days of January. In 2024, this high time for tourism in Macau took place fully in February. In monthly terms, the IPC descended 0.19 percent in February, while “the average General IPC of the 12 -month ending in the reference month, compared to the immediately previous 12 months (March 2023 to February 2024), ascended 0.57 percent,” added DSEC. In February, the price indices of the leisure, recreation, sport and culture (-5.03 percent), transport (-4 percent), information and communication (-2.83 percent) and clothing and footwear (-1.98 percent) registered the largest falls compared to the same-year month. The price indices of the sections of various products and services, alcohol and tobacco and education and education increased 2.05, 2.03 and 1.17 percent, respectively, in annual terms. The price index of food products and non -alcoholic beverages (+0.69 percent) and housing and fuels (+0.31 percent) also ascended in annual terms.
